text: A small puzzle. I edited a line in an already published blog post, and uploaded it fine. But JuliaBloggers decided to re-tweet every entry in the RSS/XML feed.xml, which was bad, because retweeting old nonsense posts from 5 years ago is bad. :slightly_smiling_face: I suppose `__site/feed.xml` is getting rewritten (because everything in there is?) each time Franklin updates, but the actual contents (inc dates) shouldn't have changed, I think. So somewhere along the line JuliaBloggers is checking the incoming RSS/XML feed and deciding that it's all worth repeating again. Not a current problem but if anyone has any thoughts about why this happens, and how to stop it....

is getting rewritten (because everything in there is?) each time Franklin updates, but the actual contents (inc dates) shouldn't have changed, I think. text:
Oops sorry for the nuisance! a couple of things to check:
1. if you’re using `fd2html` in a `hfun` , make sure to pass `internal=true` otherwise page variables are reset and you don’t want that; normally you’re not supposed to use `fd2html` in a hfun (if you’re producing markdown, you should use a lxfun but that’s another discussion)
2. if your hfun needs to ensure that all pages have been processed before being executed properly (so that it has access to all page vars properly), then you need to add `@delayed`  in front of the function definition (see <http://franklinjl.org/demos|franklinjl.org/demos>)
If (1) or (2) don’t help, maybe tag me in your repo explaining in more details what you were trying to do and I’ll have a look?
Note: here’s a relevant example in the wild: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/www.julialang.org/blob/d825a89cf0c470930faee6c618436cb74ed1c8f3/utils.jl#L63-L66>
